section.title: File upload
section.para: Before version 2.1, CherryPy was handling file uploads as follows: it was reading the entire file in memory, store it in a string and pass it to the method. This works well for small files but not so well for big files.

CherryPy 2.1 uses the python cgi module to parse the POST data. When a file is being uploaded, this modules stores it in a temp file and returns a FieldStorage instance which contains information about this file. CherryPy then passes this FieldStorage instance to the method, this instance has the following attributes:

itemizedlist.listitem: file: the file(-like) object from which you can read the data
type: the content-type of the file
